body:
Well, I think the standard is fairly loose, but I agree it's important to get it right. I swapped SITE for APP, because I think the original intent using SITE was for designers who are literally designing sites. 

Here are a few examples:
http://www.google.com/humans.txt (completely propietary)
https://github.com/humans.txt (uses TEAM but nothing else)
http://basecamp.com/humans.txt (uses TEAM but nothing else)
http://humanstxt.org/humans.txt (uses TEAM, THANKS and SITE)

A quick browse through http://humanstxt.org/humans/ shows a number of variations.

I've asked Juano for his opinion: https://twitter.com/paulca/status/198375427063025664

—P
